title: Bede's Way Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: peter robinson / Kissing gate on Bede's Way Cleadon Hill
images.caption: Kissing gate on Bede's Way at Cleadon Hill. At this point the route passes through Cleadon Hill Local Nature Reserve, South Tyneside

images.title: Alan Fearon / Footpath, Whiteleas
images.caption: Footpath, Whiteleas. The former West Harton Mineral Line is now a foot and cycle path, part of 'Bede's Way'. This is the view looking north towards South Shields.

images.title: DAVID ELSY / Old Mill on Cleadon Hills
images.caption: Old Mill on Cleadon Hills

images.title: Footpath stile near Whitburn by Malc McDonald, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footpath stile near Whitburn

images.title: DAVID ELSY / Cleadon Hills - looking East
images.caption: Cleadon Hills

description: Follow in the footsteps of seventh century pilgrims on this interesting walk or cycle through Tyne and Wear. The trail links the twin Anglo-Saxon monastery of St Peter's in Wearmouth and St Paul’s in Jarrow. The route passes through the beautiful landscape of the Great North Forest which includes twelve miles of rolling hills and meandering streams. Trail highlights includes a waterside stretch along the River Don and the final coastal stretch along Whitburn Sands and through to the finish point near Sunderland Harbour. You'll also pass the Cleadon Hills Nature Reserve where there's a photogenic old mill and some wonderful views over the area. There is also the Bede's Cycleway which follows a very similar route to the walk - please click here for more information.
